verses.verse: Israel <S%H3478><s%> is an empty <S%H1238><s%> vine, <S%H1612><s%> he bringeth forth <S%H7737><s%> fruit <S%H6529><s%> unto himself: according to the multitude <S%H7230><s%> of his fruit <S%H6529><s%> he hath increased <S%H7235><s%> the altars; <S%H4196><s%> according to the goodness <S%H2896><s%> of his land <S%H776><s%> they have made goodly <S%H3190><s%> images. <S%H4676><s%>

Their heart <S%H3820><s%> is divided; <S%H2505><s%> now <S%H6258><s%> shall they be found faulty: <S%H816><s%> he <S%H1931><s%> shall break down <S%H6202><s%> their altars, <S%H4196><s%> he shall spoil <S%H7703><s%> their images. <S%H4676><s%>

For <S%H3588><s%> now <S%H6258><s%> they shall say, <S%H559><s%> We have no <S%H369><s%> king, <S%H4428><s%> because <S%H3588><s%> we feared <S%H3372><s%> not <S%H3808><s%> <S%H853><s%> the LORD; <S%H3068><s%> what <S%H4100><s%> then should a king <S%H4428><s%> do <S%H6213><s%> to us?

They have spoken <S%H1696><s%> words, <S%H1697><s%> swearing <S%H422><s%> falsely <S%H7723><s%> in making <S%H3772><s%> a covenant: <S%H1285><s%> thus judgment <S%H4941><s%> springeth up <S%H6524><s%> as hemlock <S%H7219><s%> in <S%H5921><s%> the furrows <S%H8525><s%> of the field. <S%H7704><s%>

The inhabitants <S%H7934><s%> of Samaria <S%H8111><s%> shall fear <S%H1481><s%> because of the calves <S%H5697><s%> of Beth-aven: <S%H1007><s%> for <S%H3588><s%> the people <S%H5971><s%> thereof shall mourn <S%H56><s%> over <S%H5921><s%> it, and the priests <S%H3649><s%> thereof that rejoiced <S%H1523><s%> on <S%H5921><s%> it, for <S%H5921><s%> the glory <S%H3519><s%> thereof, because <S%H3588><s%> it is departed <S%H1540><s%> from <S%H4480><s%> it.

It shall be also <S%H1571><s%> carried <S%H2986><s%> unto Assyria <S%H804><s%> for a present <S%H4503><s%> to king <S%H4428><s%> Jareb: <S%H3377><s%> Ephraim <S%H669><s%> shall receive <S%H3947><s%> shame, <S%H1317><s%> and Israel <S%H3478><s%> shall be ashamed <S%H954><s%> of his own counsel. <S%H4480><s%> <S%H6098><s%>
As for Samaria, <S%H8111><s%> her king <S%H4428><s%> is cut off <S%H1820><s%> as the foam <S%H7110><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> <S%H6440><s%> the water. <S%H4325><s%>

The high places <S%H1116><s%> also of Aven, <S%H206><s%> the sin <S%H2403><s%> of Israel, <S%H3478><s%> shall be destroyed: <S%H8045><s%> the thorn <S%H6975><s%> and the thistle <S%H1863><s%> shall come up <S%H5927><s%> on <S%H5921><s%> their altars; <S%H4196><s%> and they shall say <S%H559><s%> to the mountains, <S%H2022><s%> Cover <S%H3680><s%> us; and to the hills, <S%H1389><s%> Fall <S%H5307><s%> on <S%H5921><s%> us.

O Israel, <S%H3478><s%> thou hast sinned <S%H2398><s%> from the days <S%H4480><s%> <S%H3117><s%> of Gibeah: <S%H1390><s%> there <S%H8033><s%> they stood: <S%H5975><s%> the battle <S%H4421><s%> in Gibeah <S%H1390><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> the children <S%H1121><s%> of iniquity <S%H5932><s%> did not <S%H3808><s%> overtake <S%H5381><s%> them.

It is in my desire <S%H185><s%> that I should chastise <S%H3256><s%> them; and the people <S%H5971><s%> shall be gathered <S%H622><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> them, when they shall bind <S%H631><s%> themselves in their two <S%H8147><s%> furrows. <S%H5869><s%>

And Ephraim <S%H669><s%> is as a heifer <S%H5697><s%> that is taught, <S%H3925><s%> and loveth <S%H157><s%> to tread out <S%H1758><s%> the corn; but I <S%H589><s%> passed over <S%H5674><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> her fair <S%H2898><s%> neck: <S%H6677><s%> I will make Ephraim <S%H669><s%> to ride; <S%H7392><s%> Judah <S%H3063><s%> shall plow, <S%H2790><s%> and Jacob <S%H3290><s%> shall break his clods. <S%H7702><s%>

Sow <S%H2232><s%> to yourselves in righteousness, <S%H6666><s%> reap <S%H7114><s%> in <S%H6310><s%> mercy; <S%H2617><s%> break up <S%H5214><s%> your fallow ground: <S%H5215><s%> for it is time <S%H6256><s%> to seek <S%H1875><s%> <S%H853><s%> the LORD, <S%H3068><s%> till <S%H5704><s%> he come <S%H935><s%> and rain <S%H3384><s%> righteousness <S%H6664><s%> upon you.

Ye have plowed <S%H2790><s%> wickedness, <S%H7562><s%> ye have reaped <S%H7114><s%> iniquity; <S%H5766><s%> ye have eaten <S%H398><s%> the fruit <S%H6529><s%> of lies: <S%H3585><s%> because <S%H3588><s%> thou didst trust <S%H982><s%> in thy way, <S%H1870><s%> in the multitude <S%H7230><s%> of thy mighty men. <S%H1368><s%>

Therefore shall a tumult <S%H7588><s%> arise <S%H6965><s%> among thy people, <S%H5971><s%> and all <S%H3605><s%> thy fortresses <S%H4013><s%> shall be spoiled, <S%H7703><s%> as Shalman <S%H8020><s%> spoiled <S%H7701><s%> Beth-arbel <S%H1009><s%> in the day <S%H3117><s%> of battle: <S%H4421><s%> the mother <S%H517><s%> was dashed in pieces <S%H7376><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> her children. <S%H1121><s%>

So <S%H3602><s%> shall Bethel <S%H1008><s%> do <S%H6213><s%> unto you because <S%H4480><s%> <S%H6440><s%> of your great wickedness: <S%H7451><s%> <S%H7451><s%> in a morning <S%H7837><s%> shall the king <S%H4428><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> utterly be cut off. <S%H1820><s%> <S%H1820><s%>
